150554-d-02-05-99-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 57 WAS SWITCHING NAVAL BASE AND HAD SET OUT CAR SOU 50132 OUT ON MAIN LINE AND SHOVED TRAIN INTO CRANE SIDING. NAVY DOWNGRADED SITUATION TO ADVISORY STATUS AT 0835 EST ALLOWING RESIDENTSTO LEAVE THEIR HOMES ON A VOLUNTARY BASIS, BUT MAY NOT BE ALLOWED BACK FOR A ONE-MILE RADIUS.  HULCHER ARRIVED AT 1230 EST, ESTIMATED LINE CLEAR 1905 EST.  REPAIR MADE TO APPROXIMATELY 80 FEET OF SIDING TRACK AND NORTH SIDING SWITCH.  ALL APPROPRIATE RAILROAD, STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES CONTACTED AND RESPONDING.  TESTING PERFORMED AS REQUIRED UNDER SOO POLICY.  CONDUCTOR OF ASSIGNMENT WAS ASSESSED FIVE DAYS SUSPENSION AS A RESULT OF FAILING TO PROPERLY SECURE HAND BRAKE ON CAR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

BA0208991-d-02-08-99-BAR.Narrative: NO 220 WAS INSTRUCTED BY DERBY FOREMAN THAT HE WANTED SIX CARS SET ON L TRACK.  WHEN SETTING THE SIXCARS TO CLEAR FUEL TRACK A HITCH HAD TO BE MADE ON ANOTHER TWO CARS THAT WERE SETTING ON THE L LEAD.  AFTER MAKING THE HITCH ON THE TWO CARS, NO 220'S CREW SHOVED BACK TO CLEAR THE FUEL TRACK AND FAILED TO HAVE A MAN IN POITION TO OBSERVE THE TRACK BEHIND THEIR MOVEMENT.  THE ROUTE WAS LINED TO TRACK 30 AND THERE WERE FOUR CARS POSITIONED JUST BEYOND THE VIEW OF THE CREW.  THE CREW WAS UNAWARE OFTHE EXTRA FOUR CARS ON TRACK 30 AND RAN INTO THEM CAUSING THE REAR CAR BAR 105 TO ROLL ABOUT 30 INTO THE TRANSFER PIT.  BAR 105 SUSTAINED MAJOR DAMAGE.  THE FOUR EXTRA CARS ON TRACK 30 DID NOT HAVE HAND BRAKES APPLIED BUT WERE TRIGGED. THE TRACK 30 SWITCH OFF L TRACK WAS LINED FOR TRACK 30 PRIOR TOTHE SHOVING MOVEMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
